intro: Fissistigma taynguyenense, commonly known as the Tay Nguyen fissistigma, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Central Highlands of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and other tropical shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
